group.groupDescription: SQL Server 2022 Setup configuration checks for rules group 'GlobalRules'

RunRuleResult.description: Checks whether the account running SQL Server Setup has administrator rights on the computer.
RunRuleResult.message: The account running SQL Server Setup has administrator rights on the computer.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks whether the account that is running SQL Server Setup has the right to back up files and directories, the right to manage auditing and the security log and the right to debug programs.
RunRuleResult.message: The account that is running SQL Server Setup has the right to back up files and directories, the right to manage auditing and security log and the right to debug programs.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks if a pending computer restart is required. A pending restart can cause Setup to fail.
RunRuleResult.message: The computer does not require a restart.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks whether the WMI service is started and running on the computer.
RunRuleResult.message: The Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) service is running.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks if the SQL Server registry keys are consistent.
RunRuleResult.message: SQL Server registry keys are consistent and can support SQL Server installation or upgrade.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks whether the SQL Server installation media is too long.
RunRuleResult.message: The SQL Server installation media is not too long.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks whether the current version of SQL Server is compatible with a later installed version.
RunRuleResult.message: Setup has not detected any incompatibilities.

group.groupDescription: SQL Server 2022 Setup configuration checks for rules group 'InstallGlobalRules'

RunRuleResult.description: Checks if an earlier version of Machine Learning Server shared feature is currently installed.
RunRuleResult.message: No earlier version of Machine Learning Server shared feature was detected.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks if the SQL Server registry keys are consistent.
RunRuleResult.message: SQL Server registry keys are consistent and can support SQL Server installation or upgrade.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks whether the computer is a domain controller. Installing SQL Server 2022 on a domain controller is not recommended.
RunRuleResult.message: This computer is not a domain controller.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks whether the Windows Firewall is enabled.
RunRuleResult.message: The Windows Firewall is enabled. Make sure the appropriate ports are open to enable remote access. See the rules documentation at https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2162127 for information about ports to open for each feature.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks if an earlier version of SQL Server is currently installed.
RunRuleResult.message: This rule does not apply to your system configuration.

RunRuleResult.description: This rule determines if the Microsoft .NET Framework 4.7.2, or newer, is installed on the system.
RunRuleResult.message: The Microsoft .NET Framework 4.7.2, or newer, is already installed.
